page.title: 06Adbaston First School Intro.
page.content: Adbaston School opened in 1843. It is now administered by Staffordshire County Council. It has 2 full-time teachers; 1 part-time peripatetic music teacher and an ancillary lady. This lady supervises the children daily during the lunch hour. 19 of 30 pupils bring their own lunch, the remainder have school dinners (1 pupil receives a free school meal). Of the 30 pupils there are 21 boys and 9 girls, all white. Most leave to attend Eccleshall Middle School although some do go to Private Schools. There are 2 classes in separate rooms; 5 to 6.5 yrs. and 6.5 to 9 yrs. The catchment area is that part of Adbaston parish outside Shropshire, also the villages of Shebdon and Doley.
